column4: 01:00.0 VGA compatible controller [0300]: Advanced Micro Devices [AMD] nee ATI Juniper [Radeon HD 5700 Series] [1002:68b8]
what do you mean "the entire session"?
is that equivalent to what the "Additional Drivers" app does?
apt-get install fglrx seemed to actually work.. it's asking for a restart so i will try that, brb
hmm, that seemed to work

post release updates in your case will do nothing for you I do not believe. Keep in mind also that the 12-5 version removed support for all of the HD 2xxx-4xxx cards. Yours is a 5xxx so you wont have an issue with that, but I expect your chipset is next to be dropped... so... latest is not often best with ATI
this is still the case with the fglrx driver installed?
if so, it is probably flash related
yes, it's exactly the same
i thought that, but it happens also on websites that don't have flash
can you take a screenshot please?
here's an example http://imagebin.org/217577
i should probably point out that i'm using xubuntu
oh yeah... that's... thats way wrong... do not expect it is flash.
also, on some web pages it doesn't even update when i type text in a text box or click a check box
I am tempted to agree with you, though I have not had this experience... something is funky with the driver... can you open catalyst and check the settings there?

I would try sudo apt-get install fglrx-amdcccle-updates
all already installed
